meanings.definition: Serving as a symptom or sign of something
meanings.sent1: Her cough was symptomatic of a cold.
meanings.sent2: The fever was symptomatic of an infection.
meanings.sent3: His sneezing was symptomatic of being allergic to cats.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds were symptomatic of an approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: The redness and swelling were symptomatic of a bee sting.

meanings.definition: Characteristic or indicative of a particular condition or situation
meanings.sent1: His tiredness was symptomatic of a long day at work.
meanings.sent2: The broken window was symptomatic of a break-in.
meanings.sent3: Her laughter was symptomatic of finding joy in small things.
meanings.sent4: The traffic jam was symptomatic of rush hour chaos.
meanings.sent5: The silence in the room was symptomatic of everyone listening intently.
